title: E field - positive and negative objects net field

content.description: A point in space is located near both a positively charged object and a negatively charged object. At the location of this point, the electric field due to the positive object is <math alttext="E sub 0, i hat" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>E</mi> <mn>0</mn> </msub> <mspace width="0.2em"> </mspace> <mover accent="true"> <mi>i</mi> <mo>^</mo> </mover> </math> and the electric field due to the negative object is <math alttext="E sub 0, j hat" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mover accent="true"><mi>j</mi><mo>^</mo></mover></math>.
content.question: What is the magnitude of the net electric field at this point?

choices.label: <math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, times E sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the square root of 2, end root, times E sub 0" overflow="scroll"><msqrt><mn>2</mn></msqrt><msub><mi>E</mi><mn>0</mn></msub></math>

unit.text: 8: Electric Charges, Fields, and Gauss's Law

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
